titles.title: To extend until January 1, 1996, the existing suspension of duty on machines designed for heat-set, stretch texturing of continuous man-made fibers.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Executive Comment Requested from Treasury, Commerce, ITC, USTR.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means
House Committee on Ways and Means

bill.summary: 3/30/1993--Introduced. Amends the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States to extend, through December 31, 1995, the existing suspension of duty on machines designed for heat-set, stretch texturing of continuous man-made fibers.
